Message.Title: Why the bull market case is still valid: J.P. Morgan Cazenove....
Message.Msg: 1. The Federal Reserve will “err on the side of caution”: Analysts at J.P. Morgan Cazenove said the Fed probably won’t remove accommodation in the next few quarters as the output gap is “significant” and unemployment rate isn’t likely to hit its Fed target before 2015. Falling commodity prices have also reduced the potential for inflation. The Fed could gradually begin reducing purchases in the fourth quarter, according to J.P. Morgan. 2.Equities have a thick enough valuation cushion to fight a further rise in bond yields. Even if yields on the 10-year Treasury note 10_YEAR +5.02% rise 40 basis points by the end of 2013, the yield gap with stocks would be “exceptionally attractive.” 3.U.S. economy isn’t going to plunge: While data has been mixed, jobless claims — which play into the Fed’s unemployment rate target — have remained below 350,000. “This is healthy and not indicative of a shift in corporate behavior.” Moreover, the housing market has continued its recovery. 4.Finally, recent data out of the euro zone have shown an improvement as preliminary composite PMI rose for the second month and the peripheral countries’ PMI is in line with the euro-zone average, the analysts said.

Message.Title: MSFT is the cheapest and strongest stock in the Market: reasons
Message.Msg: 1) A truckload of cash 2) Dominate in sftwares in decades to come 3) Very diversified NOW, given acquitions to skype, Bing, Xbox 4) Xbox in my opionion WILL bring at least 50% of msft future revenues. The reason is that it is packed with many options for consumers to utilize TV, movies, music, Bing, Skype, games. The box itself is packed with innotive technology of voice command and kinect body motion control. This reminds me when apple came out with their first iphone, touchpad. Games using kinect motion control will amaze and dazzle-- this is star trek like , very futuristic. Many more appplications will be applied using kinect. Gaming will be different, cutting middled man, where msft charges subscription fees to game access, like neftflx, cutting out sharing. 5) Skype which has been under utilized will be one of the most used technology in every living room, where video communications can be done right into the 60 inch TV screens in every living room inthe world. 6) Bing will be integrated into the internet access, part of the Xbox experience. Bing is no match for google search at the moment but xbox enforces the use and will compete well with google search engine in the future. Given the abobe scenario, I think msft will be a trillion dollar company by 2014. It is significantly undervalue due to a decade of stagnation. This Titan has begun turning the tides, it is 1990's all over again.

Message.Title: Why home prices are rising, simple math
Message.Msg: (1) Bernanke is printing 4000 million dollars a day, that money has to flow somewhere. (2) Obama bailed out the banks with citizens money, leaving most citizens without credit to buy a house (3) Poor job pay (widest disparity in modern histoiry) leaves regular people unable to finance a home (4) Home prices overshot way to the downside. I have a friend who three years ago was buing decent small 3/2 homes for $40-$45 k and renting them instantly at $1K a month. In an investment environment where 5% is good return, you cannot have an investment returning 30% go unnoticed for long. It is reported by an agent I know that hedge funds are buying houses because of the rental market and they could buy for $40 / sf while building costs $85 a s.f. Simply put they went too low just as they went too high so FROM THE BOTTOM they had to rise, nothing to do with Obama policy other than that is why it took so long.

Message.Title: Diversity Does Not Make America Great
Message.Msg: You often hear catchy things said such as it is diversity that makes America great. One needs to get beyond the emotion-based, incomplete liberal thought process, beyond the thrill up the leg from such soaring rhetorical nonsense. It is not our diversity itself that has made this a great country, though our diversity makes us an interesting country, shows the character and depth of our culture. It is the amazing, outrageous, unprecedented FOUNDATIONS OF FREEDOM AND LIBERTY - which establishes 'We The People' as the ruler that holds ultimate power - that our Founders set up as our government THAT ALLOWS OUR RICH DIVERSITY that makes America great! The fact that we as individuals of all races, religions, gender, heritage all have the same freedoms that the government cannot infringe upon sets us apart from any other country that has ever existed. We don't allow a centralized government, dictator, king, or even a president to pick and choose which rights will be granted or not. These foundations ALONE are what have fostered America to be the great nation it is. That is why people from around the world die trying to claim these American foundations, trying to get here on ramshackle rafts, stowing away in the diseased holds of ships or in the inferno of a sealed 18-wheeler trailer, and crossing miles of desert climate. It is also for these foundations that hundreds of thousands of men and women in our armed forces have died defending. We are not simply another country at the global table of nations, nor are we just one side of a war wearing different jerseys than the opposing team. Yesterday's Memorial Day is the pinnacle of American holidays, in honor of those who will never be forgotten by true Americans. It is these foundations that we must protect from today's domestic enemies. You can usually find them spouting meaningless speeches and slogans like 'Yes We Can' and 'Forward.' . And saying things like 'diversity is what has made America great.'

Message.Title: Holder "feels personal remorse" LMAO for getting caught
Message.Msg: According to the Daily Beast, Attorney General Eric Holder supposedly felt personal remorse upon reading the Washington Post report that broke the story of the Department of Justice’s subpoena of Fox News reporter James Rosen‘s private information. After reading the Post front-page story on the Rosen leak probe, in addition to the ongoing AP snooping story, Holder’s aides claim the AG began to feel a “creeping sense of personal remorse.” Despite having personally signed off on the search of Rosen’s private information, “the gravity of the situation didn’t fully sink in” for Holder until he saw the newspaper report based on the affidavit for the search warrant that helped the feds obtain Rosen’s private data. A source close to the Attorney General told the Daily Beast that despite the ongoing scandals, “Eric sees himself fundamentally as a progressive, not some Torquemada out to silence the press.”

Topic.Title: Why Microsoft won't sell off Bing or Xbox

Message.Msg: not possible to sell off bing. even for nominal $1. it cost $300 to $500 mio. more per qtr to operate than online services division get in income from all units in division. they take in $869 mio. for a loss of $283 mio. that over $1 billion differential. that not all bing tho. some other unit must lose money too. but how many units can lose $billions every year. i think not more than one per division. and maybe not even one in any other divisions either. any mgr. with multiple mega-$million losing operations is obeying instructions or has compromising photos of higher-ups. new owner would have to be able to spend that much or more forever unless they can find a way to make money with it. and they can have to keep all current revenue msft have with bing now. could be worse if advertisers and partners jump.

Message.Title: Why the US economy is ready to expand....
Message.Msg: Folks we have had a good month on the housing and stock market fronts, but this is just the beginning.... Demand is still weak as we still have 7.5% unemployment and the budget sequester impact is not here fully yet and that is why the Fed will keep the $85 billion a month of Bond purchases intact till Q4/2013 and even then it will reduce it gradually by $5-10 billion per month with pauses in between to make sure the recovery can not be reversed.... Having said that the folks who were on the sideline to buy a house will now get serious as we had 10.9% YoY price increase and that will drive new home construction and stimulate real demand on material and labor which will accelerate the economy as people will buy more cars/trucks/stuff et al; especially as the gasoline prices are quite affordable thus boosting more consumer spending and the happy days will be here once again in The United States Of America. AS the housing prices appreciate and the Stock Market heads North, the wealth effect(s) will get more retail investors into the Stock Market and there goes the cries of the Trolls on this Board.... ADD to that growth in Japan and Europe that will drive not only the US economy higher but also rev up China. Stay Long And Prosper. Osso
